content: Small, fast SRAM sitting between the core and main RAM. Organized in levels: L1 (per-core, ~4 cycles), L2 (per-core or shared, ~12 cycles), L3 (shared across cores, ~40 cycles). The cache hierarchy exploits temporal and spatial locality — most programs re-access the same data and nearby addresses repeatedly. Cache misses stall the pipeline and dominate performance on memory-bound workloads. Compare with cache (disk-level) and cache (CDN/proxy-level) — same principle, different latency scale.
